Did you try turning it in unity?

This thread will likely be moved to the modelling and texturing subforum, so look there if it gets lost

The issue with your part being rotated is likely because you need to rotate the axis of your part so that the +y axis is pointing up (instead of the +z axis) before you export it from your modelling program.

Here's a writeup on how to fix the issue, if you're using Blender.

If you're using 3DS Max, you need to open up the Hierarchy Editor tab, then choose "Affect Pivot Only", then rotate the gizmo to the proper orientation (Green arrow pointing up. If the object's gizmo is oriented with the world, then rotating the x axis 90 degrees will accomplish this.) before unselecting "Affect Pivot Only".
